io.amelia.lang

Interface ExceptionContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ApplicationException.Error, ApplicationException.Ignorable, ApplicationException.Notice, ApplicationException.Runtime, ConfigException.Error, ConfigException.Ignorable, ContainerException, DatabaseException, EventException.Error, EventException.Ignorable, EventException.Internal, FoundationCrashException, HttpError, IllegalTaskCreatorAccessException, LooperException, LooperException.InvalidState, MultipleException, NetworkException.Error, NetworkException.Ignorable, NetworkException.Notice, NetworkException.Runtime, PacketValidationException, ParcelableException.Error, ParcelableException.Ignorable, ParcelException.Error, ParcelException.Ignorable, ParcelException.Notice, ParcelException.Runtime, PermissionBackendException, PermissionDeniedException, PermissionException, PermissionValueException, PluginDependencyUnknownException, PluginException.Error, PluginException.Ignorable, PluginException.Internal, PluginException.Unconfigured, PluginInvalidException, PluginMetaException, PluginNotFoundException, RankingException, StartupException, StartupInterruptException, SynchronizeException, UncaughtException, UserException.Error, UserException.Runtime

    public interface ExceptionContext
    Used by AmeliaCommonLib to carry exception contextual information about an exception into the Kernel. You can either wrap the target exception with a subclass implementing this interface or implement this interface directly on any subclass of Throwable, the ladder being recommended.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ExceptionReport getExceptionReport() 
      default java.lang.String getMessage()
      Returns the message associated with this ExceptionContext
      ReportingLevel getReportingLevel()
      Returns the ReportingLevel for this ExceptionContext
      java.lang.Throwable getThrowable()
      Returns the Throwable associated with this ExceptionContext or itself if this interface is implemented on an subclass of Throwable
      default ReportingLevel handle(ExceptionReport exceptionReport, ExceptionContext exceptionContext)
      Called to properly add exception information to the ExceptionReport which is then used to generate a script trace or ApplicationCrashReport

      Typically you would just add your exception to the report with report.addException( this ); and provide some possible unique debug information, if any exists.
      default boolean isIgnorable() 
      default boolean notIgnorable() 
      default void printStackTrace() 
      default java.lang.String printStackTraceToString()

      • getExceptionReport

        @Nonnull
ExceptionReport getExceptionReport()

      • handle

        default ReportingLevel handle(ExceptionReport exceptionReport,
                              ExceptionContext exceptionContext)
        Called to properly add exception information to the ExceptionReport which is then used to generate a script trace or ApplicationCrashReport

        Typically you would just add your exception to the report with report.addException( this ); and provide some possible unique debug information, if any exists.

        Parameters:
        exceptionReport - The ExceptionReport to fill
        exceptionContext - The Exception Context
        Returns:
        The reporting level produced by this handler, returning null will cause the application to conclude it's own handling procedure, which is essentially the same as returning ReportingLevel.E_UNHANDLED.

      • isIgnorable

        default boolean isIgnorable()

      • notIgnorable

        default boolean notIgnorable()

      • printStackTrace

        default void printStackTrace()

      • printStackTraceToString

        default java.lang.String printStackTraceToString()
